quotes.message: All that glitters is not gold.
quotes.name: Latin Proverb

quotes.message: Clean your finger before you point at my spots.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Clothes don't make the man.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Clouds that thunder, do not always rain.
quotes.name: Armenian

quotes.message: Empty vessels make the most sound.
quotes.name: John Lydgate

quotes.message: Every ass loves to hear himself bray.
quotes.name: English

quotes.message: His bark is worse than his bite.
quotes.name: George Herbert

quotes.message: If someone gives you advice, it is in his own interest.
quotes.name: Tunisian Proverb

quotes.message: It is better to enjoy the cool breeze of others waving your flag, than to suffer the sweat of doing it yourself.
quotes.name: L.D. Seese

quotes.message: It is better to light one candle than to curse the darkness.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: No one can make us feel inferior without our consent.
quotes.name: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.message: Nobody's perfect.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: The cat would eat fish but would not get her feet wet.
quotes.name: Chaucer

quotes.message: The drum makes a great fuss because it is empty.
quotes.name: Trinidadian

quotes.message: The fly on the water buffalo's back thinks he is taller than the water buffalo.
quotes.name: Tagalog

quotes.message: The wise through excess of wisdom is made a fool.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Vanity blossoms but bares no fruit.
quotes.name: Nepalese

quotes.message: Never underestimate a man who overestimates himself.
quotes.name: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.message: Cure yourself of the affliction of caring how you appear to others. Concern yourself only with how you appear before God, concern yourself only with the idea that God may have of you.
quotes.name: Miguel de Unamuno

quotes.message: There was never yet fair woman but she made mouths in a glass.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: They say that hens do cackle loudest when there is nothing vital in the eggs they have laid.
quotes.name: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.message: Our vanity is the constant enemy of our dignity.
quotes.name: Madame Anne Sophie Swetchine

quotes.message: We are so vain that we even care for the opinion of those we don't care for.
quotes.name: Marie Ebner-Eschenbach

quotes.message: There are no grades of vanity, there are only grades of ability in concealing it.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Vanity is often the unseen spur.
quotes.name: William Makepeace Thackeray

quotes.message: There is nothing so agonizing to the fine skin of vanity as the application of a rough truth.
quotes.name: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quotes.message: Vanity is so secure in the heart of man that everyone wants to be admired - even I who write this, and you who read this.
quotes.name: Blaise Pascal

quotes.message: Vanity is the quicksand of reason.
quotes.name: George Sand

quotes.message: Vanity plays lurid tricks with our memory.
quotes.name: Joseph Conrad

quotes.message: What makes the vanity of others insupportable is that it wounds our own.
quotes.name: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.message: One of the troubles about vanity is that it grows with what it feeds on. The more you are talked about, the more you will wish to be talked about.
quotes.name: Bertrand Russell

quotes.message: We think we are being interesting to others when we are being interesting to ourselves.
quotes.name: Jack Gardner

quotes.message: The vanity of others runs counter to our taste only when it runs counter to our vanity.
quotes.name: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.message: Vanity can easily overtake wisdom. It usually overtakes common sense.
quotes.name: Julian Casablancas

quotes.message: I'm not the greatest; I'm the double greatest. Not only do I knock 'em out, I pick the round.
quotes.name: Muhammad Ali

quotes.message: It is naturally given to all men to esteem their own inventions best.
quotes.name: Thomas More

quotes.message: We say little if not egged on by vanity.
quotes.name: Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.message: It is difficult to esteem a man as highly as he would wish.
quotes.name: Luc de Clapier de Vauvanargues

quotes.message: We would rather speak ill of ourselves than not talk about ourselves at all.
quotes.name: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.message: Self-love is the greatest of all flatterers.
quotes.name: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.message: No man thinks there is much ado about nothing when the ado is about himself.
quotes.name: Anthony Trollope

quotes.message: If there is a single quality that is shared by all great men, it is vanity. But I mean by 'vanity' only that they appreciate their own worth. Without this kind of vanity they would not be great. And with vanity alone, of course, a man is nothing.
quotes.name: Yousef Karsh

quotes.message: It is very queer, but not the less true, that people are generally quite as vain, or even more so, of their deficiencies than of their available gifts.
quotes.name: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.message: Mirrors are dangerous things. They can just as easily tell us what we don't like as what we do. Yet in truth you can't tell anything from a reflection, as a reflection is actually empty.
quotes.name: Susie Staplehurst

quotes.message: Vanity is a weakness. I know this. It's a shallow dependence on the exterior self, on how one looks instead of what one is.
quotes.name: Dennis Lehane

quotes.message: There are two kinds of people in this world: people who want to be desired, and people who want to be desired so much that they pretend they don't.
quotes.name: Rabih Alameddine

quotes.message: Pride makes us esteem ourselves; vanity makes us desire the esteem of others.
quotes.name: Hugh Blair

quotes.message: However anxious one is to reach one's goal, one can excuse delays on the route when these are caused by ovations.
quotes.name: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.message: Every author, however modest, keeps a most outrageous vanity chained like a madman in the padded cell of his breast.
quotes.name: William Wordsworth

quotes.message: My strict hand . Was made to cease on vice, and with a gripe . Squeeze out the humour of such spongy souls, . As lick up every idle vanity.
quotes.name: William Wordsworth

quotes.message: Nothing is more foolish than a security built upon the world and its promises, for they are all vanity and a lie.
quotes.name: Matthew Henry

quotes.message: At all times but especially now, it is pertinent to say, 'Vanity of vanities, all is vanity'.
quotes.name: St. John Chrysostom

quotes.message: Most of us would be far enough from vanity if we heard all the things that are said of us.
quotes.name: Joseph Rickaby

quotes.message: Vain thoughts defile the heart as well as vile thoughts.
quotes.name: William Secker

quotes.message: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity, and quicken thou me in thy way.
quotes.name: Psalm 119:37

quotes.message: All is vanity. All go unto one place; all are of the dust and all turn to dust again.
quotes.name: Ecclesiaster 3:19-20

quotes.message: We know nothing vainer than the minds of men.
quotes.name: John Calvin

quotes.message: Do not concern yourself with anxiety for the show of a great name.
quotes.name: Thomas a Kempis

quotes.message: Vanity and pride are different things, though the words are often used synonymously. Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves, vanity to what we would have others think of us.
quotes.name: Jane Austen

quotes.message: It is very often nothing but our own vanity that deceives us.
quotes.name: Jane Austen

quotes.message: To come with a well-informed mind is to come with an inability of administering to the vanity of others, which a sensible person would always wish to avoid.
quotes.name: Jane Austen

quotes.message: Vanity while seeking its own guilty triumph at the expense of another, had involved him in a real attachment, which extravagance, or at least its offspring, necessity, had required to be sacrificed.
quotes.name: Pride and Prejudice

quotes.message: Is there a vanity greater than the vanity of those who believe themselves without it?
quotes.name: Amanda Cross

quotes.message: Those who live on vanity must, not unreasonably, expect to die of mortification.
quotes.name: Anne Ellis

quotes.message: I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty...but I am too busy thinking about myself.
quotes.name: Edith Sitwell

quotes.message: The inner vanity is generally in proportion to the outer self-deprecation.
quotes.name: Edith Wharton

quotes.message: Vanity, like murder, will out.
quotes.name: Hannah Cowley

quotes.message: The sin of pride may be a small or a great thing in someone's life, and hurt vanity a passing pinprick, or a self-destroying or even murderous obsession.
quotes.name: Iris Murdoch

quotes.message: Wounded vanity knows when it is mortally hurt; and limps off the field, piteous, all disguises thrown away. But pride carries its banner to the last; and fast as it is driven from one field unfurls it in another.
quotes.name: Helen Hunt Jackson

quotes.message: Men always want to be a woman's first love. That is their clumsy vanity. We, women, have a more subtle instinct about things. What we like is to be a man's last romance.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: One of the things that I have almost most wondered at is, that there should be any such thing as human vanity. If I had any, I had enough to mortify it a few days ago, for I lost my mind for a whole day.
quotes.name: Alexander Pope

quotes.message: Foolish people follow after vanity. Wise people guard vigilance as their greatest treasure.
quotes.name: Gautama Buddha

quotes.message: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity; for vanity shall be his recompense.
quotes.name: Job 15:31

quotes.message: Success is always short-lived, so boastfulness is empty vanity.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: To boast of a performance which I cannot beat is merely stupid vanity. And if I can beat it that means there is nothing special about it.
quotes.name: Emil Zatopek

quotes.message: How soon may our fairest prospects be leveled with the dust and show us that man in his best estate is but vanity and dust?
quotes.name: Abigail Adams

quotes.message: What female mind—young, beautiful, rich,—must she not be more than woman if vanity was not the predominate passion?
quotes.name: Abigail Adams
